it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.modules

Class MatrixApplyFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Symbol<?>>
        • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.SymbolTable
          • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.DatasetRecord
            • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.MatrixModule
              • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.modules.MatrixApplyFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Symbol<?>>

    public class MatrixApplyFunction
extends MatrixModule
    in its funcArgs argument, this constructor receives the actual referecens to the attributes of the input module. However, this does not create problems like in FilterModule because the actual references are re-extracted in the setup() routine, which is called in turn by changeInput(MatrixModule) when necessary
    Author:
    edoardovacchi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatrixApplyFunction

        public MatrixApplyFunction(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String inputTable,
                   java.lang.String schemaName,
                   java.lang.String functionName,
                   java.util.List<Symbol<?>> funcArgs,
                   Symbol<?> result,
                   FilterCondition fc)
        Parameters:
        name - name of the module
        inputTable - input module
        schemaName - schema of the input module
        functionName - name of the function
        funcArgs - a list of references to the attributes of the input modules
        result - a freshly-generated attribute where the result should be written to
        fc - a filter definition

      • exec

        public void exec()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        this method has no longer a real purpose. It is invoked by the interpreter when all of the input script has been processed, for all modules in the script, in sequence.
        Specified by:
        exec in class MatrixModule

        public void changeInput(MatrixModule m)
        invokes setup() to re-extract the correct references from the given new input module
        Overrides:
        changeInput in class MatrixModule
        Parameters:
        m - the new module to be set as input (passed by reference, does not need to belong to the module list).

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        resets the internal state of the module: it restore the internal cursor to the first record of the dataset, and it restores any other variable to sane defaults.
        Specified by:
        reset in class MatrixModule

      • hasMore

        public boolean hasMore()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        this method returns true until the dataset has reached its last record. When the last record is reached it returns false. This method is allowed to manipulate the internal state of the object, provided that two subsequent call to this method does not change any observable result (e.g., this method should not advance the internal pointer)
        Specified by:
        hasMore in class MatrixModule
        Returns:
        true until the dataset has reached its last record

      • next

        public void next()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        advances the internal pointer to the next record in the dataset. Implementors may choose to return an error if MatrixModule.hasMore() is false. When a module has been constructed and setup, this method should invoked at least once, before accessing the values pointed at (e.g. using MatrixModule.get(Object)).
        Specified by:
        next in class MatrixModule
